concepts.label: Public Safety
concepts.description: The paramount obligation of engineers to protect the safety, health, and welfare of the public in their professional activities.
text_references: Engineers shall hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public.

concepts.label: Professional Competence
concepts.description: The requirement that engineers only practice within their areas of expertise and technical capability.
text_references: Engineers shall perform services only in areas of their competence.

concepts.label: Truthful Communication
concepts.description: The obligation for engineers to make public statements that are objective, factual, and honest.
text_references: Engineers shall issue public statements only in an objective and truthful manner.

concepts.label: Fiduciary Duty
concepts.description: The responsibility of engineers to act as faithful agents or trustees for their employers or clients, prioritizing their interests within ethical boundaries.
text_references: Engineers shall act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees.

concepts.label: Honesty
concepts.description: The ethical requirement to avoid deceptive acts or misrepresentations in professional practice.

concepts.label: Professional Conduct
concepts.description: The obligation for engineers to conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully to uphold the reputation of the engineering profession.
text_references: Engineers shall conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully so as to enhance the honor, reputation, and usefulness of the profession.
